alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:45PM CDT until April 05 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ST. FRANCIS...SOUTHEASTERN POINSETT...SOUTHWESTERN MISSISSIPPI...CRITTENDEN...EASTERN CROSS AND NORTHWESTERN SHELBY COUNTIES... At 1245 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marked Tree to near Earle to near Jennette, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Marion, Earle, Parkin, Tyronza, Joiner, Crawfordsville, Sunset, Gilmore, Jericho, Jennette, Crittenden, Turrell, Clarkedale, Birdsong, Three Forks, Dimple, Booker, Deckerville and Menesha. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
